title: Observation of Structural & Chemical Configuration, Lattice Distortion, Defect Dynamics and Phase Evolution in High-Entropy Transition Metal Carbides (HE-MAX)
content: Mixing multiple transition metals opened a new ideology to explore the designable components and tunable structures with modifiable physicochemical performances, and led to the discovery of new properties of the MAX phase family [1]. HE-MAX phase exhibit extraordinary mechanical strong properties and also compatible with excellent thermal-shock resistance, corrosion resistance, and thermal & electrical conductivity that promote wide applications prospective. The unprecedented mechanical properties were found to be closely related to short-range orderings, local lattice distortion, sluggish diffusion, and other features resulted from high configuration entropy [2-4].
